data: Refer to Regional Clinical Practice Document: Hypoglycemia Management in Adults
For Patients with decreased consciousness or are unable to swallow and no established tube feeds or TPN or NPO
2 pathways: With IV Access or Without IV Access
Hypoglycemia: for blood glucose below 4 mmol/L
If no IV, RN only may attempt to establish IV access for maximum of 2 minutes. Do not delay hypoglycemia treatment unnecessarily to obtain IV access
Once blood glucose is above 3.9 mmol/L, recheck blood glucose 1 hour post last result and refer to follow up instructions in the Regional Clinical Practice Document: Hypoglycemia Management in Adults

If blood glucose is less than 4 mmol/L:   1. Administer 25 mL dextrose 50% injection   2. Repeat blood glucose in 15 min and if patient is conscious and able to swallow proceed to step 1 of "NIA Hypoglycemia Management - Conscious Patient (Adult) (Module)"   3. If patient remains unconscious, repeat 25 mL dextrose 50% injection   4. Repeat blood glucose in 15 min, if blood glucose remains below 4 mmol/L notify Provider / NP for further treatment   5. Once blood glucose is above 3.9 mmol/L, recheck blood glucose 1 hour post last result and refer to the Regional Clinical Practice Document: Hypoglycemia Management in Adults
12.5 g, IV direct, as directed, PRN hypoglycemia, first dose: NOW
If patient remains unconscious and blood glucose remains below 4 mmol/L
RN and RPN Only, LPN requires Prescriber order prior to administering glucagon

If blood glucose is less than 4 mmol/L:   1. Administer glucagon subcutaneous and monitor airway (glucagon may cause vomiting). Consider placing in recovery position   2. Repeat blood glucose in 15 min and if patient is conscious and able to swallow proceed to step 1 of "NIA Hypoglycemia Management - Conscious Patient (Adult) (Module)"  3. If patient remains unconscious, repeat glucagon subcutaneous  4. Repeat blood glucose in 15 min, if blood glucose remains below 4 mmol/L notify Provider / NP for further treatment  5. Once blood glucose is above 3.9 mmol/L, recheck blood glucose 1 hour post last result and refer to  the Regional Clinical Practice Document: Hypoglycemia Management in Adults
1 mg, subcutaneous, as directed, PRN hypoglycemia, drug form: kit, first dose: NOW
